# Networking Tools - Pentesting Learning Lab

> Hands-on learning project for penetration testing and ethical hacking fundamentals using 17 open-source tools, 28 task-focused scripts, and a Docker-based vulnerable lab.

Built by Patryk Golabek - Cloud-Native Software Architect
GitHub: https://github.com/PatrykQuantumNomad/networking-tools
Docs: https://patrykquantumnomad.github.io/networking-tools/

## Tools (17)

### Security Tools
- Nmap: Network scanning & host discovery
- TShark: CLI packet capture & analysis (Wireshark CLI)
- Metasploit: Penetration testing framework
- Hashcat: GPU-accelerated password cracking
- John the Ripper: Versatile password cracker
- SQLMap: Automatic SQL injection testing
- Nikto: Web server vulnerability scanner
- hping3: Packet crafting & network probing
- Aircrack-ng: WiFi security auditing suite
- Skipfish: Web application security scanner
- Foremost: File carving & data recovery
- ffuf: Fast web fuzzer
- Gobuster: Directory & subdomain enumeration

### Networking Tools
- curl: HTTP requests & endpoint testing
- dig: DNS record lookups & tracing
- Netcat: TCP/UDP connections & port scanning
- Traceroute: Route tracing & latency analysis

## Use-Case Scripts (28)

Task-focused scripts for common pentest scenarios. Each script prints 10 numbered example commands with explanations.

### Script Flags
- `-h, --help`: Print usage and exit
- `-x, --execute`: Run commands against the target (default: show only)
- `-j, --json`: Output as structured JSON (requires jq); add `-x` to capture live results
- `-v, --verbose`: Increase output detail (curl, dig scripts)
- `-q, --quiet`: Suppress informational output (curl, dig scripts)

### JSON Output Modes
- Show mode (`-j`): Example commands as JSON `{description, command}`
- Execute mode (`-j -x`): Run commands, capture `{description, command, exit_code, stdout, stderr}`
- Envelope: `{meta: {tool, script, target, category, started, finished, mode}, results: [...], summary: {total, succeeded, failed}}`

## Docker Lab Targets

Intentionally vulnerable applications for safe, legal practice:
- DVWA (port 8080): Classic vulnerable web app
- Juice Shop (port 3030): Modern OWASP vulnerable app
- WebGoat (port 8888): OWASP teaching platform
- VulnerableApp (port 8180): OWASP vulnerable Java web app

## Diagnostics

Auto-report scripts for network troubleshooting:
- DNS Diagnostic: Comprehensive DNS troubleshooting report
- Connectivity Diagnostic: Layer-by-layer check from DNS to TLS
- Performance Diagnostic: Hop-by-hop latency analysis with traceroute and mtr
